metadata.title: CVE-2021-38493 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Firefox 91 andFirefox ESR 78.13. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruptionand we presume that with enough effort some of these could have beenexploited to run arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR <78.14, Thunderbird < 78.14, and Firefox < 92.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38493` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 92.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '92.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in noble, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1').
